headline: Manager, Google.org
summary:
I am a purpose-driven experienced leader, program manager, mobilizer of volunteers, trainer and presenter all with a particular focus in corporate social responsibility. I have the strong ability to build a business (for profit and nonprofit) from the ground up from an operations, strategy, staffing, training, and business development perspective (domestically and internationally). Highly successful in formulating and implementing creative business solutions to operational issues, processes and policies. Skilled in developing strong client relationships by consistently delivering excellent service and exceeding client expectations. Proven track record of exceeding professional expectations, evolving quickly and ultimately establishing oneself as a key contributor to the overall success of the organization, team and business unit.

Specialties: Product giving, corporate volunteering, social impact, corporate social responsibility, technology, mobile commerce, marketing, international relations, governmental affairs, client services, account and project management, human resources (U.K. and U.S.), interviewing, line management across different business units, global expansion and operational development, fundraising, public speaking, philanthropy

My personal mission: To advocate for a more inclusive world for people with disabilities. To ensure the world is a better place for my nephew!

Volunteer roles where I serve my personal mission:
-Chief of Staff for Google's Disability Alliance, a global Employee Resource Group
-Board Member, Special Olympics Northern California & Nevada
-Career Guru, for Google employees

experiences.title: Manager, Google.org
experiences.description:
Google.org is responsible for Google’s strategic corporate philanthropy. We manage charitable giving programs that invest millions of dollars in high-impact, technology-enabled nonprofits around the world.

I lead our skills-based volunteering efforts across the Americans region including Google.org’s flagship employee engagement and professional development offering. Googlers complete up to six months of full-time pro bono work to accelerate the social impact of Google.org nonprofits & civic entities.

experiences.title: Program Manager & Lead, Google for Nonprofits
experiences.description:
I was the global program lead responsible for Google's product giving across ~50 countries. Google for Nonprofits provides free tools to nonprofit organizations that allow them to work more quickly and efficiently, reach a wider audience, spur more supporters to take action, and tell their story in a more compelling way. 

In addition to our products, I managed the programs that connected nonprofits with Google volunteers across our offices worldwide, so that we could further help the nonprofits build out their mission capacity so that they can focus on what matters most: achieving their social impact goals!

experiences.title: Global Search Lead, SMB
experiences.description: Identify the global product priorities, size the revenue opportunity, and be the glue to scale the change effectively across the SMB organization as they go to market.

experiences.title: Sales Executive, National Strategic Partnerships
experiences.description: Partnering with National Merchants to win over connected consumers wherever they are; bring people looking for products and services online to the store location; and measure in-store impact of promotional spend.

experiences.title: Incubation Lead, Local Incubation - GeoCommerce
experiences.description:
-Founding member of Local Incubation Team for GeoCommerce at Google 
-Developed and iterated on the processes and materials needed to support the Mid-market & National Sales teams
-Responsible for all communication & training from the cross-functional team to the Sales team which resulted in our Sales Director awarding me the ‘XFN Partner Award’ 
-Planned and executed the first ever international Local Business Forum in London which included 14 local businesses, 45 Googlers and all relevant product VPs
-Managed 6 Sales Reps in Austin who completed 100+ monetization surveys ahead of schedule in <4 weeks resulting in a recommended go to market monetization strategy for the cross-functional team
-Supported launch of new offer format, Offers surfaced in Google Maps including external communication & marketing collateral

experiences.title: Account Manager, Local Strategic Partnerships
experiences.description:
-Managed relationships with SMBs, helping them navigate existing local products & pilot new ones
-Led the quarterly Google Offers Local Business Forum, an internal/external 75-person event 
-Interviewed 30+ potential new hires and developed new hire training for the cross-functional team
-Developed & launched the escalation process for the cross-functional team
-Spearheaded the Marketing Task Force & developed Offers Awareness Day across 8 offices

experiences.title: Global Program Manager, Clinical Technologies
experiences.description:
-Drove UBC’s expansion into Japan and traveled there in January 2011 to meet with 12 prospective clients and to interview and hire UBC’s first Japan-based Project Manager
-Directly supervised a team of 12 Project Managers to ensure the highest quality of service to clients generating approximately $5M in revenue in 2010-2011
-Served as the clients primary program-level point of contact including weekly status reports across projects, all escalation & resolution management needs & quarterly business reviews

experiences.title: Manager, Project Management Office & Partnerships
experiences.description:
-Singlehandedly interviewed, trained and managed all 12 Project Managers for UBC’s expanding U.K. office with reporting responsibilities directly to the General Manager
-Established, developed and managed client relationships with top tier pharmaceutical companies with study teams based in Europe, the United States and Asia requiring extensive travel

experiences.title: Global Project Manager I, II & III (back to back promotions)
experiences.description:
-Served as primary point of contact for global clients throughout all phases of clinical trial system development and maintenance, including authoring system requirements & conducting user acceptance testing
-Presented at sales meetings for current and prospective clients and trained end-users at client-held global meetings with attendance ranging from 200 to 800 medical professionals
-Co-Lead the on-boarding & standardization process for what is now UBC’s #1 Client, awarding UBC with a total of 54 projects since on-boarding them in early 2009 until March 2011

experiences.title: Global Project Manager
experiences.description:
-Actively participated in all phases of product design and delivery on projects including a Department of Defense, Smallpox Vaccination System used by the United States Army, an HIV/AIDS Management System deployed in Rwanda, Africa
-Developed Voxiva’s first portal-based product, the Africa Clinical Trials Portal, in collaboration with The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and six public/private international partners
-Managed global corporate operations like the business development pipeline to ensure accurate revenue forecasting & built the first global intranet used by employees across 5 countries

experiences.title: Office of Presidential Personnel, Intern
experiences.description:
-Reported to Deputy Associate Director of Presidential Personnel in researching, interviewing and appointing roughly 70 candidates to various boards and commissions at the White House
-Prepared the final folder with candidate recommendations for review by the President of the United States at weekly meeting

education.field_of_study: International Relations (World Trade and Development), English and Spanish

education.school: Stanford University Graduate School of Business

accomplishment_honors_awards.title: Local Business Forum, Project Management Excellence
Google Product Launch Team Member Award

accomplishment_courses.name: Marketing Without Money: Social Media and SEO

volunteer_work.title: Lead Google Relationship Manager & Volunteer
volunteer_work.company: Special Olympics World Games Los Angeles 2015
volunteer_work.description: Served as lead volunteer supporting Special Olympics World Games in an effort to receive all the benefits Google can offer inclusive of funding, 500 Google volunteers, $1 million of value in kind product donations, and more.

volunteer_work.title: Board Member
volunteer_work.description:
Serve as Board Member to raise acceptance and awareness for people with disabilities.

Special Olympics is the leading voice in raising awareness about the abilities of people with intellectual disabilities. Through sports, we showcase the skills and dignity of our athletes. We also bring together communities to see and take part in the transformative power of sports. We know the odds our athletes must overcome and the barriers they face every single day. Their stories and successes inspire us all. 

We believe in a world where there are millions of different abilities but not disabilities. 

Special Olympics Northern California enriches the lives of more than 21,000 children and adults with intellectual disabilities and their communities in Northern California through sports, education, and athlete health.

volunteer_work.title: Chief of Staff, Disability Alliance (ERG)
volunteer_work.description: Lead for Google's Disability Alliance, a group for employees who care about disability, learning differences, special needs, or neurodiversity, whether for themselves or a child, relative, or friend. We share advice, advocate, and build awareness, and we are passionate about creating innovative and inclusive teams, products, education, and workplaces.

volunteer_work.title: Career Guru
volunteer_work.description:
Serve as Career Guru for Google employees with 5 star rating based on post-session surveys!

With such great guidance from mentors throughout my career, I am paying it foward!

volunteer_work.title: Volunteer, Global Impact Challenge, Google.org
volunteer_work.description: Volunteered as Global Impact Awards applicant reviewer for U.K. grantees in March 2013 & India grantees in September 2013. Continued to support impact challenges in different capacities during 2014 & 2015 as well.

volunteer_work.title: Communications Co-Lead for the United Way, Women’s Leadership Council
Summer Intern
volunteer_work.description:
-Organized & led high-profile events in NYC for more than 1,950 families who lost loved ones during September 11th terrorist attacks
-Corresponded, communicated and met with major New York City institutions and influential New Yorkers to coordinate events and fundraise for the cause

volunteer_work.title: Global Leadership, Google.org, in Ghana (October 2014) & as an Alumni Lead (May 2015)
volunteer_work.description: A leadership development and consulting opportunity where Googlers spend 1 month in-country working with small businesses, NGOs, and entrepreneurs to address global humanitarian challenges in emerging markets, like Ghana.

recommendations:
Carol Grunberg



Working with Erin was one of the highlights of my time at Google. The range of her capabilities and her proactivity in stretching herself is commendable.  Erin is insightful, focused and continuously striving to make everything she touches turn to gold. It usually does!

Sara Basson



I have worked closely with Erin for the last 2+ years, in our leadership capacities with Disability Alliance, the Google Disability ERG. As a volunteer organization, Erin has been instrumental in engaging the community, finding the right talent, and inspiring them to get involved. Her magnetism is unparalleled. She has an impressive ability to take on a project, identify the necessary components, and get work done (individually, or by using that magnetism to engage other people.) She has a creative mind that takes mundane projects and makes them interesting and unique. It is a pleasure and a privilege to work with Erin, and learn from her many talents.

Tomas Remotigue



Erin was my first external hire when building up my new team, and she was a tremendous go-getter from the start. She possesses a great mix of leadership, project management skill, and attention to detail and is able to simply get things done regardless of obstacles. I'm proud to have had her on my team and she was instrumental in  helping to build it from the ground up.

Andrea Guinto



I've established a good working relationship with Erin ever since she first interviewed me for the Project Coordinator role at UBC.  Since then, she's been an terrific mentor and advocate for my professional growth.  I have enjoyed working with Erin and would work for her again in a heart beat.

G Virdi



Erin is a very high performing team leader, who has successfully delivered a number of large key global projects within the agreed budget, resources and timelines. She is an excellent leader, setting clear expectations of team members, holds team members accountable for their deliverables and provides coaching as required. I enjoyed working with her not only as a professional colleague, but also as a person. I can only aspire to work with a colleague such as Erin in the future.

Paul Jones



It is always a pleasure to work with Erin. Her in depth knowledge of the product & industry is perfectly balanced with her professional approach to working with clients. Erin is a great support to all functional areas that she works with, and is a great asset to UBC.
